008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
012
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This class represents an 'integral image' or 'summed area table' as proposed in [1], 
017 * See Sec. 2.8 of [2] for a detailed description.
018 * Currently only implemented for images of type {@link ByteProcessor}.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] F. C. Crow. Summed-area tables for texture mapping. SIGGRAPH, Computer Graphics 18(3), 207â€“212 (1984).<br>
022 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/07/11
027 *
028 */
029public class IntegralImage {
030        
031        private final int M, N; 
032        private final long[][] S1, S2;
033        
034        /**
035         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link IntegralImage} instance from pixel values 
036         * in a 2D int-array I[x][y].
037         * @param I pixel values
038         */
039        public IntegralImage(int[][] I) {
040                M = I.length;                   // image width
041                N = I[0].length;                // image height
042                S1 = new long[M][N];
043                S2 = new long[M][N];
044                
045                // initialize top-left corner (0,0)
046                S1[0][0] = I[0][0];
047                S2[0][0] = I[0][0] * I[0][0];
048                // do line v = 0:
049                for (int u = 1; u < M; u++) {
050                        S1[u][0] = S1[u-1][0] + I[u][0];
051                        S2[u][0] = S2[u-1][0] + I[u][0] * I[u][0];
052                }
053                // do lines v = 1,...,h-1
054                for (int v = 1; v < N; v++) {
055                        S1[0][v] = S1[0][v-1] + I[0][v];
056                        S2[0][v] = S2[0][v-1] + I[0][v] * I[0][v];
057                        for (int u = 1; u < M; u++) {
058                                S1[u][v] = S1[u-1][v] + S1[u][v-1] - S1[u-1][v-1] + I[u][v];
059                                S2[u][v] = S2[u-1][v] + S2[u][v-1] - S2[u-1][v-1] + I[u][v] * I[u][v];
060                        }
061                }
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link IntegralImage} instance from pixel values in the 
066         * specified {@link ByteProcessor}.
067         * @param I input image
068         */
069        public IntegralImage(ByteProcessor I) {
070                this(I.getIntArray());
071        }
072        
073        // -------------------------------------------------------
074        
075        /**
076         * Returns the summed area table of pixel values (Sigma_1).
077         * @return array of Sigma_1 values
078         */
079        public long[][] getS1() {
080                return S1;
081        }
082        
083        /**
084         * Returns the summed area table of squared pixel values (Sigma_2).
085         * @return array of Sigma_2 values
086         */
087        public long[][] getS2() {
088                return S2;
089        }
090        
091        // -------------------------------------------------------
092        
093        /**
094         * Calculates the sum of the pixel values in the rectangle
095         * R, specified by the corner points a = (ua, va) and b = (ub, vb).
096         * TODO: allow coordinates outside image boundaries
097         * 
098         * @param ua leftmost position in R
099         * @param va top position in R
100         * @param ub rightmost position in R
101         * @param vb bottom position in R
102         * @return the first-order block sum (S1(R)) inside the specified rectangle 
103         * or zero if the rectangle is empty.
104         * 
105         */
106        public long getBlockSum1(int ua, int va, int ub, int vb) {
107                if (ub < ua || vb < va) {
108                        return 0;
109                }
110                final long saa = (ua > 0  && va > 0)  ? S1[ua - 1][va - 1] : 0;
111                final long sba = (ub >= 0 && va > 0)  ? S1[ub][va - 1] : 0;
112                final long sab = (ua > 0  && vb >= 0) ? S1[ua - 1][vb] : 0;
113                final long sbb = (ub >= 0 && vb >= 0) ? S1[ub][vb] : 0;
114                return sbb + saa - sba - sab;
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Calculates the sum of the squared pixel values in the rectangle
119         * R, specified by the corner points a = (ua, va) and b = (ub, vb).
120         * TODO: allow coordinates outside image boundaries
121         * 
122         * @param ua leftmost position in R
123         * @param va top position in R
124         * @param ub rightmost position in R
125         * @param vb bottom position in R
126         * @return the second-order block sum (S2(R)) inside the specified rectangle
127         * or zero if the rectangle is empty.
128         */
129        public long getBlockSum2(int ua, int va, int ub, int vb) {
130                if (ub < ua || vb < va) {
131                        return 0;
132                }
133                final long saa = (ua > 0  && va > 0)  ? S2[ua - 1][va - 1] : 0;
134                final long sba = (ub >= 0 && va > 0)  ? S2[ub][va - 1] : 0;
135                final long sab = (ua > 0  && vb >= 0) ? S2[ua - 1][vb] : 0;
136                final long sbb = (ub >= 0 && vb >= 0) ? S2[ub][vb] : 0;
137                return sbb + saa - sba - sab;
138        }
139        
140        /**
141         * Returns the size of (number of pixels in) the specified rectangle.
142         * @param ua leftmost position in R
143         * @param va top position in R
144         * @param ub rightmost position in R {@literal (ub >= ua)}
145         * @param vb bottom position in R {@literal (vb >= va)}
146         * @return the size of the specified rectangle
147         */
148        public int getSize(int ua, int va, int ub, int vb) {
149                return (ub - ua + 1) * (vb - va + 1);
150        }
151        
152        /**
153         * Calculates the mean of the image values in the specified rectangle.
154         * 
155         * @param ua leftmost position in R
156         * @param va top position in R
157         * @param ub rightmost position in R {@literal (ub >= ua)}
158         * @param vb bottom position in R {@literal (vb >= va)}
159         * @return the mean value for the specified rectangle
160         */
161        public double getMean(int ua, int va, int ub, int vb) {
162                int size = getSize(ua, va, ub, vb);
163                if (size <= 0) {
164                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("region size must be positive");
165                }
166                return getBlockSum1(ua, va, ub, vb) / size;
167        }
168        
169        /**
170         * Calculates the variance of the image values in the specified rectangle.
171         * parameters.
172         * @param ua leftmost position in R
173         * @param va top position in R
174         * @param ub rightmost position in R {@literal (u1 >= u0)}
175         * @param vb bottom position in R {@literal (v1 >= v0)}
176         * @return the variance for the specified rectangle
177         */
178        public double getVariance(int ua, int va, int ub, int vb) {
179                int size = getSize(ua, va, ub, vb);
180                if (size <= 0) {
181                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("region size must be positive");
182                }
183                double s1 = getBlockSum1(ua, va, ub, vb);
184                double s2 = getBlockSum2(ua, va, ub, vb);
185                return (s2 - (s1 * s1) / size) / size;
186        }
187
188}
